episodeTitle: Save the Children! The Straw Hats Start to Fight!
description: The Straw Hats discover giant children in a mysterious facility on Punk Hazard. Nami decides to help the children escape from hazmat-suited soldiers, while Luffy's group crosses the lake between the hot and cold zones. Meanwhile, Smoker encounters Trafalgar Law at the facility entrance.

events.title: Nami's Group Discovers the Biscuits Room
events.description: Nami, Sanji, Chopper, Franky, and Kin'emon's head escape from the prison cell and arrive in the Biscuits Room, where they encounter giant children.
events.significance: First encounter with the children who are victims of Caesar Clown's experiments, setting up the Straw Hats' mission to save them.

events.title: Giant Children Debut
events.description: The Straw Hats meet the giant children for the first time, including Mocha, Sind, Konbu, Doran, Ally, Biyo, and Uzu. The children are abnormally large due to Caesar's experiments.
events.significance: Introduction of the children who have been experimented on with gigantification drugs, revealing the dark side of Caesar Clown's research.

events.title: Kin'emon's Severed Head Frightens the Children
events.description: Kin'emon's disembodied head speaks and terrifies the giant children while searching for his son Momonosuke among them.
events.significance: Comedic moment that also establishes Kin'emon's desperate search for Momonosuke, adding emotional weight to his character.

quotes.speaker: Kin'emon
quotes.context: Kin'emon's severed head desperately calls out for his son

events.title: Hazmat Soldiers Pursue Nami's Group
events.description: Soldiers wearing hazmat suits begin chasing Nami's group and the children through the facility, creating a tense escape situation.
events.significance: Escalates the conflict and forces the Straw Hats to make a decision about whether to escape or protect the children.

events.title: Nami Decides to Save the Children
events.description: Despite initially planning to escape, Nami's compassion for children prompts her to declare war on anyone who makes a kid cry, committing the group to rescue the children.
events.significance: Pivotal character moment for Nami that defines the Straw Hats' mission for the rest of the Punk Hazard arc, showcasing their heroic nature.

quotes.text: I'm declaring war on anyone who makes a kid cry!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami's emotional declaration to protect the children

events.title: Sanji Uses Collier Strike
events.description: Sanji engages the hazmat suit soldiers using Collier Strike, a Diable Jambe variation where he delivers a devastating flaming kick to the opponent's neck.
events.significance: Demonstrates Sanji's post-timeskip combat abilities and his commitment to protecting the children alongside Nami.

quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji attacks the hazmat soldiers with his Diable Jambe technique

events.title: Franky and Chopper Join the Fight
events.description: Franky and Chopper assist Sanji in battling the hazmat soldiers to protect the children and create an escape route.
events.significance: Shows the teamwork and unity of the Straw Hats in protecting innocent victims.

events.title: Usopp's Midori Boshi: Boaty Banana
events.description: Usopp demonstrates his new Pop Green technique, shooting a seed onto the water that instantly grows into a large banana-shaped boat capable of withstanding the boiling lake water.
events.significance: First use of this creative Pop Green ability, showcasing Usopp's growth during the timeskip and his mastery of botanical weaponry.

quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp creates a banana boat to cross the dangerous lake

events.title: Usopp's Midori Boshi: Uchiwa So (Fan Grass)
events.description: Usopp shoots a Pop Green that sprouts into tall grass with fan-shaped ends, used to paddle the Boaty Banana across the lake.
events.significance: Another demonstration of Usopp's versatile Pop Green abilities learned during his training on the Boin Archipelago.

events.title: Luffy's Group Crosses the Lake
events.description: Luffy, Zoro, Robin, and Usopp successfully use the Boaty Banana to cross the lake that separates the hot and cold sides of Punk Hazard.
events.significance: The group progresses deeper into Punk Hazard, moving toward the cold side where they will encounter more of Caesar's operations.

events.title: Centaur Attacks Luffy's Group
events.description: A centaur that Luffy's group previously defeated reappears and attacks them near the lake, seeking revenge.
events.significance: Demonstrates the persistence of Caesar's subordinates and the dangerous nature of the artificial creatures on Punk Hazard.

events.title: Centaur Alerts His Boss
events.description: The centaur calls out to alert his boss on the other side of the island about the Straw Hats' arrival.
events.significance: Sets up future confrontations with higher-ranking members of Caesar's organization.

events.title: Brook Builds Snowmen
events.description: Brook entertains himself on the frozen side of Punk Hazard by constructing elaborate snowmen, showcasing his carefree personality.
events.significance: Provides comedic relief and demonstrates Brook's lighthearted nature even in dangerous situations.

events.title: Brook Encounters Kin'emon's Torso
events.description: Brook discovers and engages in combat with a mysterious sword-wielding torso, which is actually the separated lower half of Kin'emon wielding fire-based sword techniques.
events.significance: Sets up the reveal of Kin'emon's separated body parts and leads to the next episode's major conflict between Brook and the samurai torso.

events.title: Smoker Arrives at Punk Hazard Facility
events.description: Captain Smoker and his Marine battalion arrive at the main Punk Hazard research facility, investigating the distress signal and reports of Straw Hat activity.
events.significance: Brings the Marines into direct conflict with both the Straw Hats and the illegal operations on Punk Hazard, escalating the arc's tension.

events.title: Trafalgar Law Appears at the Facility
events.description: Trafalgar Law, now one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea, emerges from the facility entrance to confront Smoker and the Marines.
events.significance: First appearance of Law in the Punk Hazard arc, revealing his connection to the island and setting up major plot developments.

events.title: Law's Warlord Status Revealed
events.description: It is revealed that Trafalgar Law sent one hundred pirate hearts to the World Government to earn his position as one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea.
events.significance: Major revelation about Law's recent actions and his new status in the world, showing his ruthlessness and strategic thinking.

quotes.text: Law sent one hundred hearts to the World Government to get his position as a Warlord.
quotes.speaker: Marines
quotes.context: Marines explain how Law became a Warlord

events.title: Law Claims Punk Hazard is His Vacation Home
events.description: When confronted by Smoker about his presence on Punk Hazard, Law lies and claims the island is his vacation home, attempting to deflect suspicion.
events.significance: Shows Law's deceptive nature and hints at his deeper involvement with the island's illegal operations.

quotes.text: Why are you at my vacation home?
quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law
quotes.context: Law's attempt to deceive Smoker about his presence

events.title: Caesar Orders His Men to Hide
events.description: In his laboratory, Caesar Clown is informed of Smoker's arrival and commands his subordinates to hide the ships and themselves. He transforms into gas and hides in a beaker.
events.significance: Reveals Caesar's awareness of the Marine presence and his ability to transform into gas, foreshadowing his Devil Fruit powers.

quotes.text: I'm declaring war on anyone who makes a kid cry!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami's emotional declaration to protect the children

quotes.speaker: Kin'emon
quotes.context: Kin'emon's severed head desperately calls out for his son

quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji attacks the hazmat soldiers with his Diable Jambe technique

quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp creates a banana boat to cross the dangerous lake

quotes.text: Why are you at my vacation home?
quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law
quotes.context: Law's attempt to deceive Smoker about his presence

themes.description: The episode heavily emphasizes the Straw Hats' protective instincts toward children, with Nami declaring war on anyone who makes children cry. This reinforces the crew's moral compass and heroic nature.
themes.symbolism: The giant children represent innocence corrupted by adult greed and ambition, symbolizing the consequences of unethical experimentation.

themes.description: Multiple characters engage in deception - Law lying about the island being his vacation home, Caesar hiding from the Marines, and the underlying deception of the children's situation.
themes.symbolism: The dual nature of Punk Hazard (fire and ice) mirrors the dual nature of the characters and their hidden truths.

themes.description: Kin'emon's desperate search for Momonosuke while literally separated into body parts emphasizes themes of family bonds and the desire for reunion.
themes.symbolism: Kin'emon's physical separation symbolizes the emotional separation from his charge and the completeness he seeks through reunion.

characterSpotlights.development: Nami's maternal instincts and compassion for children take center stage as she makes the pivotal decision to abandon escape plans and instead fight to save the giant children from their captors.
keyActions: Discovers the giant children in the Biscuits Room
Declares war on anyone who makes children cry
Commits the group to rescuing the children despite danger
quotes: I'm declaring war on anyone who makes a kid cry!

characterSpotlights.development: Usopp demonstrates his growth during the timeskip by showcasing multiple new Pop Green techniques that prove instrumental in helping his group navigate Punk Hazard's hazardous terrain.
keyActions: Creates Boaty Banana to cross the boiling lake
Uses Uchiwa So (Fan Grass) as paddles

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji immediately springs into action to protect the children, using his Diable Jambe techniques against the hazmat soldiers and showing his chivalrous nature extends to protecting all those in need.
keyActions: Supports Nami's decision to save the children

characterSpotlights.development: Law's appearance at the facility raises questions about his involvement with Punk Hazard and his true intentions, while his new Warlord status demonstrates his growing influence in the world.
keyActions: Confronts Smoker at the facility entrance
Lies about Punk Hazard being his vacation home
Revealed to have sent 100 hearts to become a Warlord
quotes: Why are you at my vacation home?

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expanded Franky's hairstyle demonstrations, adding more comedic moments not present in the manga.
Brook's snowman construction sequence was extended for comedic effect in the anime.
The anime added scenes of the samurai's torso cutting down Brook's snowmen, which was not in the manga.

trivia.fact: This episode covers material from Chapter 658 (pages 2-11) and Chapter 659 (pages 5-9, 13) of the manga.
The episode aired in Japan on February 3, 2013, but was simulcast in the US on February 2, 2013, making it available to American audiences one day before the Japanese broadcast date.
This episode marks the first time in the Punk Hazard arc that all major plot threads (Nami's group, Luffy's group, Brook, and the Marines) are shown converging toward conflict.
The centaurs on Punk Hazard were created using Trafalgar Law's Ope Ope no Mi ability to attach animal parts to human prisoners.
During this period of One Piece (episodes 279-1070), Toei Animation did not produce ending themes, only using instrumental previews at the end of episodes.
The episode had a TV rating of 9.0% in Japan and ranked #6 for its time slot.
